intro: Plagiobothrys tenellus var. echinatus, commonly known as the spiny bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and distinctive, inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
